message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Allopurinol is a xanthine oxidase inhibitor that decreases uric acid production and is first-line for chronic therapy of gout. Methotrexate is used for rheumatoid arthritis and other autoimmune diseases. Colchicine is used to treat acute gout attacks and can cause diarrhea, so it’s not suitable for chronic therapy. Indomethacin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug used to treat pain and inflammation but is not first-line for chronic therapy of gout.
